intro: Sarothamnus scoparius, commonly known as the creeping thornsteppe, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in rocky, arid, or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant has small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers in the spring. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Sarothamnus scoparius is often used in landscaping for its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
